body: Tim, Thanks for the 50 cents and I am admittedly not that familiar with the rhino -ViewCapturetoFile command.  When I capture images, I typically use the "Ladybug_Capture View" component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/2iuP6rjeNNK92Eme0-zmCwCLIOHnrfPYY6mf5TV14VIH7MpfzsGyvhMvg68I8ePDEiBfgXpKCMBssiz7eAPecZoC0XS0hkis/CaputreView.JPG) It enables me to have a lot of control over the captured view and to create png animations by automating the taking of pictures when I animate a slider in GH.  With this, I am usually using a white Rhino background and not capturing transparency.  If the transparency is particularly important, I might suggest baking the geometry and using Rhino render. Let me know if any of this is helpful and if it addresses the issue. -Chris
